basis: The user expresses explicit intent to follow the plan, reiterating steps and emphasizing gentle self-talk and support-seeking; this indicates a high likelihood of executing the actions.
cognitive_dissonance: Conflicting drive to adhere to a gentle plan while patterns of skipping meals and anxiety around eating create internal tension; optimism about small steps competes with fear of failure or discomfort.
negative_thought_patterns: All-or-nothing thinking about eating (believing they must fully avoid or completely skip meals), self-criticism when plans feel hard, worry about overeating or losing control, doubt about sustained adherence.
emotional_triggers: Anxiety around eating, heat-related discomfort prompting hydration concerns, fear of judgment, relapse into habitual skipping meals; desire for support and external reminders.
coaching_notes: Maintain concrete, small-step plans; acknowledge anxiety; reinforce self-compassion; ensure hydration; use reminders; invite tweaks as needed; monitor hunger cues and safe bite sizes; celebrate small wins.
